intro: Robynsiochloa purpurascens, commonly known as the purple muhly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and vibrant purple to pink flower spikes. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its compact size and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for landscaping in drought-tolerant gardens. The species is also valued for its role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
